channel.title: CaptureTheEther on tqts.ar
channel.description: Recent content in CaptureTheEther on tqts.ar
channel.copyright: Written by tqts. All content under Creative Commons

item.title: Solving CaptureTheEther - Part 5 of 5 - Miscellaneous
item.description: This last category of challenges is a mix of various types of vulnerabilities that don't really fit into any of the other categories.

item.title: Solving CaptureTheEther - Part 4 of 5 - Accounts
item.description: These challenges are meant to teach about the fine details of EVM-compatible networks accounts, contract deployment and cryptographic key pairs.

item.title: Solving CaptureTheEther - Part 3 of 5 - Math
item.description: Third post for the CaptureTheEther CTF writeups. Now the focus is on mathematical functions.

item.title: Solving CaptureTheEther - Part 2 of 5 - Lotteries
item.description: This is the second post of a total of five, for the CaptureTheEther CTF writeups. This time, the focus will be on the Lotteries category of challenges. Most levels here will require the player to code and deploy new contracts to the network, and interact with them.

item.title: Solving CaptureTheEther - Part 1 of 5 - Warmup
item.description: This is the first post in a series about the Ethereum security introductory CTF "CaptureTheEther". There will be a total of five posts, each one of them focused in one of the categories of the game. For each level I'll describe the contract, the vulnerability, the solution I used and a conclusion about what to check when developing or auditing smart contracts.
